data.title: From Long Beach to Billboard #16…
data.meta_description: That album is Big Fish Theory by Vince Staples. It would go on to be received with critical acclaim, with many lauding its rawness in addressing complex topics of love, oppression, and the artform of…
data.text:
Introduction

That album is Big Fish Theory by Vince Staples. It would go on to be received with critical acclaim, with many lauding its rawness in addressing complex topics of love, oppression, and the artform of rap. However, with an emphasis on quantity over quality, gossip over ideas, and rivalry over support, our modern-day shift in music culture overlooks the intrinsic artistic values of albums like Big Fish Theory. Furthermore, the album’s genre-bending tendencies has paved a lane of its own, thus the mainstream media perhaps did not look deep enough into the actual music as it could have. The album caters to more of a community that is willing to look deeper and digest its experimentalism.

It is our goal to take a small step, in what will be a long journey, to celebrate one of the most powerful artforms. Hip-hop music deserves no less…
